dialogue.speaker: CUTLER
dialogue.text: Look, I haven't really focused on that kind of thing.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: What's your cut?  How much?

dialogue.speaker: CUTLER
dialogue.text: I would say...half.  Half is fair.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: No.  No way.

dialogue.speaker: CUTLER
dialogue.text: But it's...

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Thirty-percent.  No more.  Or I call another lawyer.  This is the biggest case of your life.  Don't try to negotiate.  Thirty percent.  Say yes or no.

dialogue.speaker: CUTLER
dialogue.text: This is not about money, Emil.  I need your trust in me.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: What else do you need?

dialogue.speaker: CUTLER
dialogue.text: I need to know about your background.  I need to know about your upbringing.  Why you're here.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Give me another one, please.

dialogue.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogue.text: Are you married?

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Divorced.

dialogue.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogue.text: Do you live alone?  I've been in these clothes since...the killings.  Could we stop at your place? I could take a shower...before I go into custody?

questions.Q3: Yes - Request to go to Jordy's place to take a shower

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: I can't take you to my place.

dialogue.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogue.text: Somewhere else?

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: The men are out of quarters - practicing putting out fires.

dialogue.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogue.text: So...the station is empty?

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Yeah.  This way.

questions.Q3: Yes - Going to empty fire station

dialogue.speaker: LEON
dialogue.text: He got my gun!  Motherfucker was filming the whole time!

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: I know.  Relax.  Take it easy.  Don't worry, we'll get those fuckers.

dialogue.speaker: ROSE
dialogue.text: He said he was her cousin.  I told him where she works.  They were just here.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Describe him.

dialogue.speaker: ROSE
dialogue.text: Tall, short-haired, scary eyes.  Second guy with him was...shorter, with a wrestler's build.  And he wouldn't turn his videocamera off me.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: He had a videocamera?  Where is she? Quickly!

dialogue.speaker: ROSE
dialogue.text: She washes hair up at Ludwig's - a salon on 63rd and Madison.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: It's your crime scene now.  You can do what you want.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Watch the news?

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Nah, I musta missed it.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Well, just so you know.  I gave you guys the credit.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Well, just so you know, I don't care about that stuff.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Nah, why should you?

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: I don't even watch TV.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Good.  Good.  Commendable.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: You goin' to the escort service?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: You got any better ideas?

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Mind if I ride along with you?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: This has nothing to do with your fire.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: But what if it does?  You might need my help.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: I'll let you know what happens.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: This is ridiculous.  I'm not gonna be in your way - we can talk the case over.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Tell you what - I'll flip you a coin. If you win you can come with me.  If you don't win, you don't come.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: I'll call it... tails.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Look - let me talk to her.  Any leads I get, they're all yours.  Just let me have a first crack at her.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: You wanna talk to her alone?

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: What would your girlfriend think of that?

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: I don't have a girlfriend.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: My point exactly.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: I'm serious here.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: So am I.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: C'mon.  You intimidate her 'cause you're a celebrity.  She sees me differently.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: You're her Savior?  Is she the kid you're gonna save from the burning building?

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: You know what I'm saying here.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: So...who's Nicky?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: What do you want?

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Your opinion.  You see, they going to make a movie about me, too, Eddie.  And write books.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: What's your accomplishment.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: I kill someone famous.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Then do it, asshole.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Good - be tough to the end.  Actor who plays you will want to die like hero.

questions.Q5: Yes - Discussion about making a movie

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: So tabloids don't have to do re enactments.  They going to have real movie this time.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: If you kill me and film it you're putting a noose around your neck.

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: Detective, does it look like a murder?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: We don't know that yet.  It's much too early.  There's a lot to be done.

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: How many victims are up there?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: There are two bodies found at this point.

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: Can we go up to the crime scene?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: You know you can't do that.  C'mon.

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: Is it drug related?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: We don't know.  When I have more I'll let you know.

questions.Q3: Yes - Request to go to crime scene

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: I understand, but I noticed that the Fire Marshall is here with you.  Is this somehow related to the fire department?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: I really can't give out any information right now at this point.

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: Okay.  But I do understand that your partner, Leon Jackson's been injured. Is that correct?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: He was hurt, but not seriously.  He'll be fine.

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: Do you have the suspect in custody?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Um...now is not a good time, okay. Detective Jackson's hurt.  He's fine. I've got a Fire Marshall shot, Detective Jackson is hurt but not seriously.

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: Alright, cut, cut, cut.

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: Okay, til tonight.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Tonight.

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: You promise?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Yeah.  I promise.

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: Okay.  And you know what, I'll swing by my place, grab a couple pairs of shoes and maybe just test them out next to yours...How's that... Would that be a good thing.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Yeah, yeah.  Good thing.

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: See you later.  Good luck.

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: Thank you.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Don't be late.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: He's from Antigua.  His girlfriend was taking too long to put her make-up on. they were late for a party.  Stabbed her with a beer bottle.

dialogue.speaker: HAWKINS
dialogue.text: That's unique.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Yeah.  And he still went to the party.

questions.Q3: Yes - Reference to going to a party

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Come to 45 Broadway.  Don't bring the Police.  Come alone or you'll be in my next film.

dialogue.speaker: HAWKINS
dialogue.text: Look asshole.  I've been threatened by better than you.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: No.  I'm the best that's ever threatened you.

dialogue.speaker: HAWKINS
dialogue.text: I'll meet you on one condition - I get exclusivity and you surrender to me.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: We'll talk about that.  Four o'clock gives you time to go to bank.  Three hundred thousand dollars.

dialogue.speaker: HAWKINS
dialogue.text: What?  It doesn't work that way.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: If you don't want my film - I'll call another show.  And they will show it.

dialogue.speaker: HAWKINS
dialogue.text: Wait a minute.  Wait a minute.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Come alone.  Bring cash.  And we'll talk about surrendering.

questions.Q3: Yes - Request to meet at 45 Broadway at 4 o'clock

dialogue.speaker: VENDOR
dialogue.text: This all you want?

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Do you know how much killer gets for movie rights?

dialogue.speaker: VENDOR
dialogue.text: In here, says he wants a million.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Million?!  The killer gets one million dollars for a television interview?

dialogue.speaker: VENDOR
dialogue.text: Hey, tabloids paid Ted Bundy - famous serial killer - half a million for his interview.  And how much you think Monica got for writing book about the President coming on to her?  It pays to be a killer or a whore in this country. Look, you want magazine or not?

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Yes.  Both.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Did you hear what I said?

dialogue.speaker: OLEG
dialogue.text: I want to document my trip to America.

dialogue.speaker: OLEG
dialogue.text: Look.  New videocameras.  Color viewfinder.  Image stabilization. Solarization.  Night vision.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: We have no money.  Come on.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Turn that fucking thing off!

dialogue.speaker: OLEG
dialogue.text: I'm not filming.  I'm watching Milos die.  It's just like a move but realer.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Speak English!

dialogue.speaker: OLEG
dialogue.text: You said speak Czech!

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: How you erase this?

dialogue.speaker: OLEG
dialogue.text: I'll do it.  Don't hurt my camera!

dialogue.speaker: OLEG
dialogue.text: Gotta light the scene better.  Now it's more moody... like a scene from THE THIRD MAN.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Shut up.

dialogue.speaker: OLEG
dialogue.text: Does it hurt?

dialogue.speaker: OLEG
dialogue.text: Oh, shit.  I hate looking at that!

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Don't want to film this?

dialogue.speaker: OLEG
dialogue.text: What is it?

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: The video of Milos and Tamina - I told you to erase it.

dialogue.speaker: OLEG
dialogue.text: I did.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: And the whore's murder?  You didn't erase that either, did you?  Don't lie, I won't be angry.

dialogue.speaker: OLEG
dialogue.text: Why not?

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Put the camera down, Oleg.

dialogue.speaker: OLEG
dialogue.text: Let me get a shot of it.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Sit down!

dialogue.speaker: OLEG
dialogue.text: This way.  Hold it this way.  Good.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: No.  We are insane.  Who else but crazy men would film their murders?  So we kill someone famous and if we are caught, we are sent to mental hospital. But what good is money there?  Because once in hospital I say I not crazy. Just pretended to be acquitted.  We see psychiatrists.  They must certify we are sane and because of your - what is law called?  Oh - I got it.  Because of your Double Jeopardy law, we can't be tried for same crime twice.  We come out free, rich and famous!

dialogue.speaker: OLEG
dialogue.text: Good idea!

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Okay.  He has nothing to say.  Start the camera!

dialogue.speaker: OLEG
dialogue.text: Cut!

dialogue.speaker: OLEG
dialogue.text: In movie they make of us, who do you think would act me?

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: The one who got caught in the bathroom.  George Michael.

dialogue.speaker: OLEG
dialogue.text: This is my project.  I say 'action.'  I am the director!  You are the talent. You wait for me to say 'action.'  And 'action!'

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Bad last moment - I cut it out.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: I told you to cut that out before we handed in the tape!

dialogue.speaker: OLEG
dialogue.text: Be quiet.  Watch.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Why did you leave that stuff in about you being the director?

dialogue.speaker: OLEG
dialogue.text: Because I am the director.  Don't you realize, if it wasn't for my film, for my talent, my idea to do this - no way would we be sitting here right now.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Your idea?  I thought it was my idea.

dialogue.speaker: OLEG
dialogue.text: I'm serious...this - this is a great American film.  Full of violence and sex.  And I want my credit.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Credit?

dialogue.speaker: OLEG
dialogue.text: Yes.  Before we hand in the next video - I put titles on it and my credit is going to read - Directed by Oleg Razgul.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Yes.  But there's only one problem - you want credit but the problem is - I don't share credit.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Traitor!!

dialogue.speaker: OLEG
dialogue.text: No.  You are the traitor.  You are murderer.  I am director.  Action!

dialogue.speaker: HAWKINS
dialogue.text: Viewer discretion advised!

dialogue.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogue.text: You want the tape?  There it is!

dialogue.speaker: LEON
dialogue.text: And you, you'll pay for what you did!

dialogue.speaker: HAWKINS
dialogue.text: This footage will work in your favor. When the jury sees this - no matter what Cutler tries, they'll convict him.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Now that you know him, maybe you can get extra work in the next movie they make about him.

dialogue.speaker: KORFIN
dialogue.text: Yeah?

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Maybe you can be his stand-in.

dialogue.speaker: TOMMY
dialogue.text: What are you gonna do?

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Don't you get it?  He knew he was gonna get caught!  That's why he videotaped Eddie's murder - he thinks he's gonna get off.

dialogue.speaker: TOMMY
dialogue.text: Don't stoop to his level!

dialogue.speaker: STEPHEN GELLER
dialogue.text: This had nothing to do with shoes that didn't fit or my relationship with my father who, as you know, made a fortune selling penny loafers in the fifties. These people died because of the criminal actions of my doctor.

dialogue.speaker: ROBERT HAWKINS
dialogue.text: Your doctor?

dialogue.speaker: STEPHEN GELLER
dialogue.text: Yes.  My psychiatrist didn't insist that I stay on my medication.

dialogue.speaker: ROBERT HAWKINS
dialogue.text: ...so you feel absolutely no responsibility for killing these people?

dialogue.speaker: STEPHEN GELLER
dialogue.text: It was my finger that pulled the trigger, but I'm not morally responsible.  My psychiatrist knew what I was capable of.  How could I know. I'm not a doctor.

dialogue.speaker: ROBERT HAWKINS
dialogue.text: You seem very savvy for a man who's been found mentally incompetent to stand trial.

dialogue.speaker: STEPHEN GELLER
dialogue.text: Look, I'm a victim here, too.  I was a year away from getting my masters in Art, now I'll never graduate.  My life has been permanently disrupted.

dialogue.speaker: ROBERT HAWKINS
dialogue.text: Permanently disrupted?  Aren't you selling paintings now for quite a lot of money?  Hasn't this 'incident' as you call it, jump started your career as an artist?

dialogue.speaker: STEPHEN GELLER
dialogue.text: Look, I'm in here.  You call this a career move?

dialogue.speaker: ROBERT HAWKINS
dialogue.text: And isn't there a movie in the works about you?

dialogue.speaker: STEPHEN GELLER
dialogue.text: We're in negotiations, that's correct.

dialogue.speaker: ROBERT HAWKINS
dialogue.text: But doesn't the Son of Sam Law prevent criminals from profiting from their crimes?

dialogue.speaker: STEPHEN GELLER
dialogue.text: That doesn't apply to me because I'm not a criminal.  I'm not a criminal!  I wasn't convicted.

dialogue.speaker: CHILD
dialogue.text: I'm having a party tomorrow.

dialogue.speaker: FLOYD
dialogue.text: Yes, I know that sweetheart.

dialogue.speaker: CHILD
dialogue.text: Are you coming to my party?

dialogue.speaker: FLOYD
dialogue.text: No, I'm sorry, darling, I told you I won't be home for a few days.

dialogue.speaker: CHILD
dialogue.text: When are you coming home?

dialogue.speaker: FLOYD
dialogue.text: In three days, darling, I hope.

questions.Q3: Yes - Child mentions having a party tomorrow

dialogue.speaker: FLOYD
dialogue.text: Okay, sweetheart. Have a lovely Birthday Party tomorrow.

dialogue.speaker: CHILD
dialogue.text: Thank you, Daddy.

dialogue.speaker: FLOYD
dialogue.text: I'll wish you a happy Birthday now and I'll see you soon. All right, Darling?

dialogue.speaker: CHILD
dialogue.text: Yes, Daddy.

dialogue.speaker: FLOYD
dialogue.text: 'Bye, 'bye, now, sweetheart.

dialogue.speaker: CHILD
dialogue.text: Goodbye, Daddy.

questions.Q3: Yes - Reference to birthday party tomorrow

dialogue.speaker: ELENA
dialogue.text: Well, Gregor and I will look forward to seeing you.

dialogue.speaker: FLOYD
dialogue.text: Thank you. It's been a great pleasure to meet all of you... Dr. Smyslov.

questions.Q3: Yes - Reference to IAC conference in June

dialogue.speaker: FLOYD
dialogue.text: Well, as it happens, I'm on my way up to the moon

dialogue.speaker: SMYSLOV
dialogue.text: Are you, by any chance, going up to your base at Clavius?

dialogue.speaker: FLOYD
dialogue.text: Yes,as a matter of fact, I am.

questions.Q3: Yes - Discussion about going to moon base

dialogue.speaker: GANZ
dialogue.text: I want to drive awhile.

dialogue.speaker: BILLY
dialogue.text: I ain't tired yet.

dialogue.speaker: GANZ
dialogue.text: Maybe after we get done with him I'm gonna buy us some girls.

dialogue.speaker: BILLY
dialogue.text: Whaddya mean, buy?

dialogue.speaker: GANZ
dialogue.text: Pros.

dialogue.speaker: BILLY
dialogue.text: Pay money?

dialogue.speaker: GANZ
dialogue.text: Yeah, dummy.  Money.

dialogue.speaker: BILLY
dialogue.text: I never paid for it in my life.

dialogue.speaker: GANZ
dialogue.text: It's better when you pay... they let you do anything.

dialogue.speaker: BILLY
dialogue.text: They always let me do anything. I don't want to pay for it.  I never paid for it in my life.

dialogue.speaker: GANZ
dialogue.text: Just do what I say, okay? We'll pay for the girls and have a good time... Don't you trust me?

questions.Q3: Yes - Discussion about paying for girls
questions.Q4: Yes - Discussion about paying for girls

dialogue.speaker: CANDY
dialogue.text: You're in a hurry.

dialogue.speaker: HAMMOND
dialogue.text: Yeah, i been waiting three years.

dialogue.speaker: CANDY
dialogue.text: You just quit bein' a priest or somethin'?

dialogue.speaker: HAMMOND
dialogue.text: No, baby, nothin' like that. Look, there's a place across the street. We can go right over there...

dialogue.speaker: CANDY
dialogue.text: What's the matter with my place?

dialogue.speaker: HAMMOND
dialogue.text: No, it's gotta be here and now. Believe me. Only I don't have the damn money for a room...

questions.Q3: Yes - Suggestion to go to a place across the street

dialogue.speaker: CANDY
dialogue.text: Hello, again.

dialogue.speaker: HAMMOND
dialogue.text: I just struck it rich... I think we can do a little business.  As a matter of fact, I think we can have a party.

questions.Q3: Yes - Reference to having a party

dialogue.speaker: HAMMOND
dialogue.text: Here you go, baby.

dialogue.speaker: CANDY
dialogue.text: Hey, don't do that.  I said I wasn't a pro, remember?

dialogue.speaker: HAMMOND
dialogue.text: Hey, no, I'm tryin' to be nice. Buy yourself something pretty. I'd do it, but I got to go.  I got this cop waitin' for me...

dialogue.speaker: HAMMOND
dialogue.text: I'll buy ya the best dinner in San Francisco...how'd that be? Then we'll go dancin', okay?

dialogue.speaker: CANDY
dialogue.text: Now you're talkin'. See ya...

questions.Q3: Yes - Offer of dinner and dancing

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Let's go.

dialogue.speaker: HAMMOND
dialogue.text: Wait a minute.  Maybe these ladies would like to go a few laps with us.  How about it? I been nearly three years in prison and...

questions.Q3: Yes - Hammond suggests "going a few laps" with ladies after mentioning being in prison

dialogue.speaker: HAMMOND
dialogue.text: Hey, Jack, how ya doin'? What took you so long to call, man? I been waitin' ... I'm at Vroman's up in the Fillmore. Yeah, Vroman's... 'Course you don't hang out here; it's for the brothers.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: I'll be there in a minute. You don't move your ass, right?

questions.Q3: Yes - Hammond tells Cates he's at Vroman's in the Fillmore

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Yeah, I see her.

dialogue.speaker: HAMMOND
dialogue.text: I can just take her right across the street to Luther's hotel.  All I need is some money for the room.

questions.Q3: Yes - Hammond suggests taking someone to Luther's hotel

dialogue.speaker: HAMMOND
dialogue.text: Hey, how'd my car get here?

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: I had it impounded.  Come on, we'll use it for haulin' you back to the slam.

dialogue.speaker: HAMMOND
dialogue.text: Back to jail in my own car.  Ganz got away. Got all my money. It just don't seem right.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: I don't know about you, but I could use a drink... I'll buy you one.  It'll be my good-bye present.

questions.Q3: Yes - Cates offers to buy Hammond a drink as a goodbye present

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: You know, if you let me come over to your place once in a while, you could put on a clean shirt in the morning.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: What makes you think I have any clean shirts at my place?

questions.Q3: Yes - Elaine suggests coming over to Cates' place

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Maybe you ought to buy me one.

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: Maybe I would if I knew when you were coming back.

questions.Q3: Yes - Discussion about Cates coming by

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: Just one.  Some lady called.  Said she's a little hot-headed sometimes... But she still wants her occasional roommate. She'd like to talk it over after she gets off work tonight... if it's humanly possible....

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Elaine, look, I'm in the middle of sone stuff right now... I'm not gonna have time to come by. I don't know when I can get there.

questions.Q3: Yes - Reference to meeting after work

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Whaddya think?

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: What do I know?  I'm just a bartender.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Let's go, Reggie.

dialogue.speaker: GANZ
dialogue.text: How ya doin'?

dialogue.speaker: HENRY
dialogue.text: Can't complain.

dialogue.speaker: GANZ
dialogue.text: We got a lot to talk about.

dialogue.speaker: HENRY
dialogue.text: Yeah, old times.

dialogue.speaker: GANZ
dialogue.text: We'll follow you.  Take it slow,okay?

dialogue.speaker: HENRY
dialogue.text: Sure, right.

dialogue.speaker: SOSNA
dialogue.text: You want to go outside?
